translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Conditions for Phenomena, the Text in Triads

original: Dhammapaccanīya (2), Tikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (1)🔽7.12. Parittattika🔽Naparittaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… namahaggataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …pe… naappamāṇaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  parittattika  na parittam dhammam paṭicca pe na mahaggatam dhammam paṭicca pe na appamāṇam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhitta
translated: The Triad on the Limited🔽With a limited phenomenon as condition … With a great phenomenon as condition … With an exalted phenomenon as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā bāttiṁsa, ārammaṇe sattavīsa, adhipatiyā sattavīsa …pe… aññamaññe tiṁsa …pe… purejāte āsevane catuvīsa …pe… avigate bāttiṁsa.
analyzed: hetuyā bāttisa ārammaṇe sattavīsa adhipatiyā sattavīsa pe aññamaññe tisa pe purejāte āsevane catuvīsa pe avigate bāttisa
translated: With root cause as condition, there are thirty-two. With object as condition, there are twenty-seven. With predominance as condition, there are twenty-seven. … With mutual condition, there are thirty. … With prior condition, there are twenty-four. … With absence as condition, there are thirty-two.
